verse.verse_0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
verse.verse_3: And by the even and the odd.
verse.verse_4: And by the night when it departs,
verse.verse_5: Is there not in it an oath for man of understanding?
verse.verse_6: Have you not seen, what did your Lord with Aad?
verse.verse_7: The people of Iram, excessively tall.
verse.verse_8: The like of whom has not been created in cities.
verse.verse_9: And withThamud who hewed out rocks in the valley.
verse.verse_11: Those who transgressed in the cities.
verse.verse_13: Therefore your Lord let down upon them the whip of torment with force.
verse.verse_14: Undoubtedly, nothing is absent from the sight of Your Lord.
verse.verse_15: But man, when his Lord tries him and honours him and bestows favour on him, he says, 'My Lord has honoured me.'
verse.verse_16: But when He tries him and straitens his livelihood, he says, 'my Lord has disgraced me.'
verse.verse_17: Not so, but you do not honour the orphan.
verse.verse_18: And you urge not one another to feed the poor.
verse.verse_19: And devour the heritage of others greedily.
verse.verse_21: Yes, when the earth is completely broken into pieces.
verse.verse_22: And the Command of your Lord comes and also the angels in rows after rows.
verse.verse_23: And Hell is brought that day, on that day man will think, but not where is the time for thinking?
verse.verse_24: He will say, O would that I had sent forward some good works in my life.
verse.verse_25: So on that day none torments any like His torment.
verse.verse_26: And nor anyone binds like His binding.
verse.verse_28: Return to your Lord well pleased with Him, and He well pleased with you.
verse.verse_29: So enter you among My chosen bondmen.
